Key Match Events: Christian Koloko had a standout performance with 6 points, 6 rebounds, 1 assist, 1 steal, and 1 block in 11 minutes against the Pelicans.
Pre-Game Insights: The Lakers were short on centers after Jaxson Hayes sprained his ankle and were down to just two-way centers to back up Anthony Davis.
Post-Match Reflections: Head coach JJ Redick praised Koloko's performance, saying 'He was great for us.'
Redick mentioned that Koloko's performance could make it easier to part ways with one of Hayes or Christian Wood in a trade if Koloko proves to be a viable backup option.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers won the game despite Koloko's limited playing time.
Koloko's length and athleticism allowed the team to continue playing as they did with Hayes without having to change things up much.
